content: दैव {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (वी|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [देवादागतः अण्] Relating to gods, caused by or coming from gods, divine, celestial; संस्कृतं नाम दैवी वागन्वाख्याता महर्षिभिः <ls>Kāv. 1. 33</ls>; दैवीनां मानुषीणां च प्रतिहर्ता त्वमापदां <ls>R. 1. 60</ls>; <ls>Y. 2. 235</ls>; <ls>Bg. 4. 25</ls>, <ls n="Bg.">9. 13</ls>, <ls n="Bg.">16. 3</ls>; <ls>Ms. 3. 75.</ls> --वः ({%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}|विवाहः) One of the eight forms of marriage, that in which the daughter is given away at a sacrifice to the officiating priest; यज्ञस्य ऋत्विजे दैवः <ls>Y. 1. 59</ls>; (for the eight forms of marriage see उद्वाह or <ls>Ms. 3. 21</ls>). --वं {@--1@} Fate, destiny, luck, fortune; दैवमविद्वांसः प्रमाणयंति <ls>Mu. 3</ls>; विना पुरुषकारेण दैवमत्र न सिध्यति ‘God helps those who help themselves’; दैवं निहत्य कुरु पौरुषम त्मशक्त्या <ls>Pt. 1. 361.</ls> (दैवात् by chance, luckily, accidentally). {@--2@} A god, deity. {@--3@} A religious rite or offering, an oblation to gods. {@--4@} A kind of Śrāddha ceremony. {@--5@} Parts of the hands sacred to the gods, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} the tips of the fingers; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ms. 2. 59.</ls> --वी A woman married according to the form of marriage called {%daiva%} <ab>q. v.</ab> above.
